name: Kenneth

name: Corrina
biography: Corrina double majored in Zoology and Environmental Science at Miami University, whe re she graduated with her Bachelor’s Degree in 2013. As an undergraduate, she did research on the genetic diversity of the European wall lizard and interactions with adenylate cyclase toxins. After graduation, she attended the University of Cincinnati to pursue her Master of Science in Biological Sciences, with a focus in Reproductive Biology. She was awarded the University Graduate Scholarship for doing research in collaboration with the Cincinnati Zoo & Botanic Garden and Cincinnati Children’s Hospital on polar bear reproduction.
